lines.text: Reckon the folks in Red River will kinda be surprised they're gettin' three investigators when they only asked for one?
They're only gettin' one - and his two assistants.
And you're the one?
Sure!
It's awfully nice of you to take us along for the ride.
Won't you sit next to Mr. Joslin, Mr. Smith?
Thank you, but you can cut out the "Mister" business and just call me "Tucson."
Why not? All the rest of the gals do.
[Jane brings Tex, recuperating from a bullet wound, a tray of food]
Hmm, boy. Swell eats!
Yes, but not for you.
Looks like they shot the wrong fella.
Very lovely.
The lady or the music?
You play beautifully, too.
Have you heard, "I'll Kiss You in the Moonlight"?
Is that a song or a promise?
[Stony, one of the Mesquiteers, is pretending to be "Mr. Benson"]
These are the Mesquiteers, Mr. Smith and Mr. Joslin. I'd like to present Mr. Benson.
Howdy.
Strange lookin' characters, aren't they? I heard there were three of them. The third must be the brains.
[the Mesquiteers have locked a henchman in a refrigerated truck]
Say, aren't you afraid he'll catch cold?
I'm afraid the cold's gonna catch him.
I hope you're a good driver - this is a valuable load you're hauling.
Best in the land - all high-grade, government inspected citizens.
Opening day of the fishing season and you had to get hitched. Why didn't you come in yesterday?
'Cause the lady didn't say "Yes" until today.
Gee, I wish they'd hurry up.
You want to see the weddin', eh?
No, I want to get out of these store clothes!
Now, Tommy, this marriage is a serious business.
Yeah, and it's more serious as the years roll on.
[last lines]
Do you swear to tell the truth and nothing but the truth, so help... Pardon me. Do you, Tex Reilly, take this woman to be your lawfully wedded wife, so help you?
"So help him" is right!
